{"text":null,"custom_resource_settings":{"custom_internetcheck":"1","custom_maxpoints":"100","custom_institutioncheck":"0","custom_startdate":"2024-08-29T14:42:22Z","custom_submit_papers_to":"1","custom_exclude_type":"none","context_title":"Emerald Valley Academy Analysis Current Economic Issues Grade 12 (2024)","custom_use_biblio_exclusion":"0","custom_late_accept_flag":"1","custom_feedbackreleasedate":"2025-08-28T14:42:22Z","custom_s_view_reports":"1","custom_use_quoted_exclusion":"0","custom_allow_non_or_submissions":"1","custom_report_gen_speed":"0","custom_duedate":"2025-02-28T14:42:22Z","custom_erater":"0","custom_exclude_value":"0","resource_link_description":"Learnings Goals: 
 
 
 
 Students will demonstrate an understanding of economic trade-offs (e.g., whether to buy a car or a transit pass, to rent an apartment or buy a house, to send a child from an impoverished family to school or to work, to pay down government debt or increase government spending on infrastructure or social services), and explain their significance for individuals and society.","resource_link_title":"Lesson 2.2 Mini Assessment Economic Trade-Offs and Decisions","custom_journalcheck":"1","custom_studentpapercheck":"1"}}

folder.name: Lesson 4.2 Mini Assessment International Economic Developments

tii_options.error_message: Dropbox was imported from course package, and is deactivated until manually enabled.
tii_options.resource_settings_json:
{"text":null,"custom_resource_settings":{"custom_use_biblio_exclusion":"0","custom_journalcheck":"1","custom_internetcheck":"1","custom_allow_non_or_submissions":"1","custom_institutioncheck":"0","custom_maxpoints":"100","resource_link_title":"Lesson 4.2 Mini Assessment International Economic Developments","custom_exclude_value":"0","custom_exclude_type":"none","custom_feedbackreleasedate":"2025-08-28T14:46:03Z","custom_s_view_reports":"1","custom_late_accept_flag":"1","resource_link_description":"Learnings Goals: 
 
 Students will explain how globalization influences economic decisions of individuals, firms, and governments. 
 Students will explain the significance of a variety of international events/developments (e.g., natural disasters, war, terrorism, changes in governments, technological changes, increasing international debt) and policies (e.g., with respect to trade, the environment, energy, security) for the Canadian economy. 
 Students will describe Canadian government responses to global economic challenges that affect stability. 
 Students will describe ways in which individuals and groups attempt to address problems related to international economic activities. 
 
 
 Overall Expectations: 
 International Economic Developments: analyse the impact of some key international economic events and developments as well as various responses to them 
 
 Specific Expectations: 
 E2.1 explain how","custom_studentpapercheck":"1","custom_duedate":"2025-02-28T14:46:03Z","context_title":"Emerald Valley Academy Analysis Current Economic Issues Grade 12 (2024)","custom_submit_papers_to":"1","custom_erater":"0","custom_startdate":"2024-08-29T14:46:03Z","custom_use_quoted_exclusion":"0","custom_report_gen_speed":"0"}}
